text: DARK: If you occupy with exactly 2 starships, your total power here is +2. | LIGHT: If you occupy with exactly 2 starships, your total power here is +2 and Vul Tazaene anywhere is doubled.
text_dark: If you occupy with exactly 2 starships, your total power here is +2.
text_light: If you occupy with exactly 2 starships, your total power here is +2 and Vul Tazaene anywhere is doubled.

name: Kirdo III
text: DARK: If you control, Force drain -1 here. | LIGHT: If you occupy, once per turn, may search Reserve Deck and take any Desert, Kitonak, or Sandwhirl into hand; reshuffle.
text_dark: If you control, Force drain -1 here.
text_light: If you occupy, once per turn, may search Reserve Deck and take any Desert, Kitonak, or Sandwhirl into hand; reshuffle.

name: Malastare
text: DARK: If you have lost a Podrace, you may not draw more than one battle destiny here. | LIGHT: If you have won a Podrace, Force drain +1 here.
text_dark: If you have lost a Podrace, you may not draw more than one battle destiny here.
text_light: If you have won a Podrace, Force drain +1 here.

name: Mon Calamari
text: DARK: If you control without a Star Destroyer, Force drain -1 here. | LIGHT: If you occupy with a Star Cruiser, opponent's Star Destroyers may not deploy here. Your Star Cruisers deploy -1 here.
text_dark: If you control without a Star Destroyer, Force drain -1 here.
text_light: If you occupy with a Star Cruiser, opponent's Star Destroyers may not deploy here. Your Star Cruisers deploy -1 here.

name: Naboo
text: DARK: If you control, for each of your starships here, your total power is +1 in battles at Naboo sites. | LIGHT: If you control, for each of your starships here, your total power is +1 in battles at Naboo sites.
text_dark: If you control, for each of your starships here, your total power is +1 in battles at Naboo sites.
text_light: If you control, for each of your starships here, your total power is +1 in battles at Naboo sites.

name: Nar Shaddaa
text: DARK: Starships piloted by bounty hunters are power +1 here. All starships may move between here and Nal Hutta as a react. | LIGHT: Force drain +1 here. Once per game, if your control, may take Han's Toolkit into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
text_dark: Starships piloted by bounty hunters are power +1 here. All starships may move between here and Nal Hutta as a react.
text_light: Force drain +1 here. Once per game, if your control, may take Han's Toolkit into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.

name: Ord Mantell
text: DARK: Each of your bounty hunter pilots add an additional 1 to power of starships they pilot here. | LIGHT: If you control, each of opponent's bounty hunters is forfeit -2.
text_dark: Each of your bounty hunter pilots add an additional 1 to power of starships they pilot here.
text_light: If you control, each of opponent's bounty hunters is forfeit -2.

name: Raithal
text: DARK: If you control, you may raise your converted Raithal system to the top. | LIGHT: If you control, all opponent's troopers are forfeit and destiny -1.
text_dark: If you control, you may raise your converted Raithal system to the top.
text_light: If you control, all opponent's troopers are forfeit and destiny -1.

name: Ralltiir
text: DARK: Your capital starships deploy -2 here. | LIGHT: Your starships may move here as a 'react.'
text_dark: Your capital starships deploy -2 here.
text_light: Your starships may move here as a 'react.'

name: Rendezvous Point
text: DARK: - | LIGHT: Your starships deploy -2 here and are hyperspeed +2 when moving to or from here. Neither player may Force drain here.
text_light: Your starships deploy -2 here and are hyperspeed +2 when moving to or from here. Neither player may Force drain here.

name: Roche
text: DARK: Force Drain -1 here. If you control, Asteroid Sanctuary at related sector is canceled. | LIGHT: During your deploy phase, you may deploy Big One and/or Asteroid Cave to this system from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
text_dark: Force Drain -1 here. If you control, Asteroid Sanctuary at related sector is canceled.
text_light: During your deploy phase, you may deploy Big One and/or Asteroid Cave to this system from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.

name: Sullust
text: DARK: Your starships deploy +1 here. | LIGHT: To move your starship between here and Death Star II, system it orbits, or Mon Calmari requires -1 Force.
text_dark: Your starships deploy +1 here.
text_light: To move your starship between here and Death Star II, system it orbits, or Mon Calmari requires -1 Force.

name: Tatooine
text: DARK: If you control, for each of your starships here, your total power is +1 in battles at Tatooine sites. | LIGHT: If you control, for each of your starships here, your total power is +1 in battles at Tatooine sites.
text_dark: If you control, for each of your starships here, your total power is +1 in battles at Tatooine sites.
text_light: If you control, for each of your starships here, your total power is +1 in battles at Tatooine sites.

name: Tatooine
text: DARK: Unless your [Trade Federation] or [Independent Starship] starship here, you may not draw more than one battle destiny here. | LIGHT: Your movement from here using hyperspeed requires -1 Force.
text_dark: Unless your [Trade Federation] or [Independent Starship] starship here, you may not draw more than one battle destiny here.
text_light: Your movement from here using hyperspeed requires -1 Force.

name: Tibrin
text: DARK: If you control, Force drain +1 here. | LIGHT: If you occupy, during your control phase, may exchange three cards in hand for any one card in your Lost Pile.
text_dark: If you control, Force drain +1 here.
text_light: If you occupy, during your control phase, may exchange three cards in hand for any one card in your Lost Pile.

name: Yavin 4
text: DARK: If you control, for each of your starships here, your total power is +1 in battles at Yavin 4 sites. | LIGHT: If you control, for each of your starships here, your total power is +1 in battles at Yavin 4 sites.
text_dark: If you control, for each of your starships here, your total power is +1 in battles at Yavin 4 sites.
text_light: If you control, for each of your starships here, your total power is +1 in battles at Yavin 4 sites.

name: Agents In The Court / No Love For The Empire
City In The Clouds / You Truly Belong Here With Us
Dantooine Base Operations / More Dangerous Than You Realize
Diplomatic Mission To Alderaan / A Weakness Can Be Found
Hidden Base / Systems Will Slip Through Your Fingers
Massassi Base Operations / One In A Million
Mind What You Have Learned / Save You It Can
Old Allies / We Need Your Help
Plead My Case To The Senate / Sanity And Compassion
Rescue The Princess / Sometimes I Amaze Even Myself
The Hyperdrive Generator's Gone / We'll Need A New One
There Is Good In Him / I Can Save Him
Watch Your Step / This Place Can Be A Little Rough
We Have A Plan / They Will Be Lost And Confused
We'll Handle This / Duel Of The Fates
You Can Either Profit By This... / Or Be Destroyed

lore: Built from Radon-Ulzer racing engines that Watto regarded as too burned-out to be of any use. New fuel injection subsystem created by Anakin radically increases thrust.
name: Anakin's Podracer
text: Deploy on Podrace Arena. Draws 2 race destiny instead of 1. During your draw phase, if opponent has a higher race total than Anakin's Podracer, draw 3 race destiny next turn and choose 2. Once per game may take I Did It! into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.

lore: blank
name: Acclamator-Class Assault Ship
text: May add 4 pilots, 4 passengers, and 4 vehicles. Adds 1 to attrition against opponent for each piloted [Republic] starship present here. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2. Concussion Missiles may deploy aboard.

lore: Modified medium transport. Well armored. Has expanded passenger capacity to facilitate evacuation. The last transport to escape Hoth. Nearly destroyed by the Stalker.
name: Bright Hope
text: May add 1 pilot and 6 passengers. Deploys and moves like a starfighter. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilot aboard provides ability of 1.

lore: Modified medium transport. Well armored. Has expanded passenger capacity to facilitate evacuation. The last transport to escape Hoth. Nearly destroyed by the Stalker.
name: Bright Hope (V)
text: May add 2 pilots and 6 passengers. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2. If in battle with another Rebel capital starship, may draw destiny. Subtract that amount from opponent's attrition and total power.

lore: Multi-purpose Rebel Blockade Runner. Modular interior designed for troop or cargo transport. 150 meters long. Used by Rebels, pirates, corporations and the Empire.
name: Corellian Corvette
text: May add 3 pilots, 4 passengers and 1 vehicle. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilot aboard provides ability of 1.

lore: Fleet rear guard. Weapon batteries hard-wired to central targeting processor. Coordinates vicious crossfire against enemy captial starships.
name: Defiance
text: May add 5 pilots, 6 passengers, 1 vehicle and 3 starfighters. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilot aboard provides ability of 2. Each of it's weapon destiny draws are +2. Capital starships it hits are power -5.

lore: Command ship of the Rebel fleet. 1200 meters long. Masterpiece of aesthetic form. Most heavily armed and armored ship in the fleet. Admiral Ackbar's personal flagship.
name: Home One
text: May add unlimited pilots, passengers, vehicles and starfighters. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilots provide total ability of 4. Immune to attrition < 8 (< 10 when Ackbar piloting).

lore: Communications starship. Often hosts first assignment for top prospects from among newly commissioned officers.
name: Independence
text: May add 5 pilots, 6 passengers, 1 vehicle and 3 starfighters. Has shipdocking capability. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2. Immune to attrition < 3 (< 4 when a Rebel leader aboard).

lore: Winged star cruiser. Military transport for techinical units. Afforced special care by the Alliance's top engineers.
name: Liberty
text: May add 5 pilots, 6 passengers, 1 vehicle, and 3 starfighters. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2. May go to Used Pile instead of Lost Pile when forfeited (unless 'hit').

lore: Medium transport with boosted hyperdrive. Armor and capacity diminished. Crew trained for reconnaissance and swift intergalatic transport.
name: Luminous
text: Deploys and moves like a starfigher. May add 1 pilot and 6 passengers. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2. May use Covert Landing like a shuttle or starfighter (even while landed).

lore: Frequently escorts Mon Calamari star crusiers. Personally assigned by Ackbar to main Rebel fleet. Advanced scanners continuosly disrupt target acquistion signals.
name: Masanya
text: Deploys -4 to same system as any non-unique Star Cuiser. May add 3 pilots, 4 passengers and 1 vehicle. Has ship docking capability. Permanent pilot provides ability of 1. Cannot be 'hit' by missiles.

lore: Frequently escorts Mon Calamari star crusiers. Personally assigned by Ackbar to main Rebel fleet. Advanced scanners continuosly disrupt target acquistion signals.
name: Masanya (V)
text: Deploys -2 to same system as any Star Cruiser. May add 3 pilots and 4 passengers. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2. Weapon destinies targeting your starships here are -2.

lore: Modern Corellian design. Length 100 meters. Features engine system similar to that of a Corellian corvette. Dorsal hatch reveals hangar bay.
name: Medium Bulk Freighter
text: Deploys and moves like a starfighter. May add 2 pilots, 6 passengers and 1 vehicle. Permanent pilot provides ability of 1. Has ship-docking capability. Quad Laser Cannon may deploy aboard.

lore: Passenger and cargo transport built by Gallofree Yards. Enormous cargo bays can be outfitted to safely accommodate large numbers of troops, munitions or supplies.
name: Medium Transport
text: May add 1 pilot, 4 passengers and 1 vehicle. Deploys and moves like a starfighter. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilot aboard provides ability of 1.

lore: Mon Cal MC80 cruiser. Originally a civilian ship. Converted to military use following the liberation of Mon Calamari from the Empire.
name: Mon Calamari Star Cruiser
text: Deploys only at Mon Calamari or any Rebel Base. May add 5 pilots, 6 passengers, 1 vehicle and 3 starfighters. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilot aboard provides ability of 2.

lore: Product of Imperial Kuat Drive Yards. Several captured by Alliance. Imperial crews promptly defected. Can be outfitted for a variety of missions requiring mid-size capital starships.
name: Nebulon-B Frigate
text: May add 4 pilots, 4 passangers, and 2 starfighters. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilot provides ability of 1. Turbolaser batteries and laser cannons may deploy aboard for free.

lore: Nebulon-B frigate used as a mobile medical facility. Extra cargo space and weapon batteries have been modified to allow for more armor and more recovery areas.
name: Redemption
text: May add 4 pilots and 4 passengers. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilot provides ability of 1. Your medical droids and Bacta Tank 'patients' may deploy aboard for free.

lore: Nebulon-B frigate used as a mobile medical facility. Extra cargo space and weapon batteries have been modified to allow for more armor and more recovery areas.
name: Redemption (V)
text: May add 4 pilots and 4 passengers. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2. When deployed, may deploy a non-[maintenance] Rebel aboard from your Lost Pile.

lore: Has conducted several successful ambushes on Imperial convoys. Veteran crew. Has a reputation for arriving when least expected.
name: Spiral
text: May deploy -3 as a 'react.' May add 3 pilots, 4 passengers and 1 vehicle. Has ship-docking ability. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2.

lore: Royal House of Alderaan consular ship. Used by Princess Leia for Imperial Senate business (and secret Rebel espionage). Captured by the Devastator over Tatooine.
name: Tantive IV
text: May be deployed even without presence or Force icons. May add 3 pilots and 4 passengers. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2.

lore: Royal House of Alderaan consular ship. Used by Princess Leia for Imperial Senate business (and secret Rebel espionage). Captured by the Devastator over Tatooine.
name: Tantive IV (V)
text: May deploy without presence or Force icons. May add 3 pilots and 4 passengers. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2. Adds one [Light Side] icon here.

lore: Blank.
name: Wild Karrde
text: May add 3 pilots and 6 passengers. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2. During battle, your total battle destiny is +1 for each smuggler aboard. Deploys and moves like a starfighter. Immune to attrition < 5.

lore: Utilizes dense formations on attack mission to concentrate firepower. This tactic is particulary effective in defeating deflector shields.
name: B-wing Attack Squadron
text: * Replaces 3 B-Wings at one location (B-wings go to Used Pile). Permanent pilots provide total ability of 3. Each of its weapon destiny draws is +1.

lore: A squadron of X-wings ran interference for Y-wings during their assault on the Death Star. Keeping a tight formation dramatically increased the squadron's efficiency.
name: X-wing Assault Squadron
text: *Replaces 3 X-wings at one location (X-wings go to Used Pile). Permanent pilots provide total ability of 3.

lore: The Rebel Alliance deploys starfighters in triangular formations to minimize exposure to enemy fire. Two function as wingmen to cover one leader.
name: Y-wing Assault Squadron
text: * Replaces 3 Y-wings at one location (Y-wings go to Used Pile). May add 3 pilots or passengers. Permanent pilots provide total ability of 3.

lore: R2-D2 saved Luke and his starfighter more times than the young pilot could count.
name: Artoo-Detoo In Red 5
text: May add 1 pilot. Permanent astromech aboard is *R2-D2, who adds 2 to power, maneuver and hyperspeed. Luke of ability < 5 deploys free aboard. Immune to attrition < 5 when Luke piloting.

lore: Created by General Dodonna and Rebel engineer Walex Blissex. Designed to combat the speed and maneuverability of the TIE interceptor. Jamming suite disrupts enemy communications.
name: A-wing
text: Permanent pilot provides ability of 1. Opponent may not 'react' to or from here. Power -1 when opponent has a starfighter present with higher maneuver.

lore: Blank.
name: Azure Angel
text: May add one pilot and one astromech. During battle, if Anakin or R2-D2 aboard, may lose 1 Force to cancel a non-[Immune to Sense] interrupt. While Anakin or R2-D2 aboard, immune to attrition < 5 (< 6 if both).

lore: Blue Squadron B-Wing. Ordered to lead attack on Executor. Drew enemy fighters away from strike force led by General Calrissian and Commander Antilles.
name: Blue Squadron 5
text: May add 1 pilot. May fire two or more weapons during battle. Each of its weapon destiny draws is +2. Immune to attrition < 4 when Ten Numb piloting.

lore: B-wings ordered to attack Imperial command starships at Battle of Endor. Armed with armor-penetrating missiles. Maintained by Verpine mechanics.
name: Blue Squadron B-wing
text: Deploy -2 to Roche. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2 and adds 1 to power. May fire two or more weapons during battle. Each of its weapon destiny draws is +2.

lore: Owned by legendary Terrik family of smugglers. Used to chase down the pirates who killed Wedge's parents. On Corellian Security's most wanted list. 37.5 meters long.
name: Booster In Pulsar Skate
text: May add 1 pilot and 6 passengers.  Permanent pilot is •Booster, who provides ability of 3. Once per game, may deploy Mirax here from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Immune to Lateral Damage and attrition < 5.

lore: Ric Olie's starfighter at the battle of Naboo. Conrtol configuration modified by Ric himself.
name: Bravo 1
text: Deploys -1 to Naboo. May add 1 pilot. While Ric piloting, immune to attrition < 4 and draws one battle destiny if unable to otherwise.

lore: Starfighter assigned to Officer Dolphe at the battle of Naboo. Damaged when the Trade Federation first invaded his planet, but Dolphe was able to make the necessary repairs.
name: Bravo 2
text: Deploys -1 to Naboo. May add 1 pilot. While Dolphe piloting, immune to attrition < 4. While at Naboo system, your Bravo Squadron pilots at same system are forfeit +2.

lore: Arven Wendik's starfighter at the Battle of Naboo. Oldest starfighter in the Naboo corps.
name: Bravo 3
text: Deploys - 1 to Naboo. May add one pilot. While Arven piloting, immune to attrition < 4. While at Naboo system, opponent's battle destiny draws are - 1 here.

lore: Flown by Rya Kirsch at the Battle of Naboo. Bravo 4 was primarily used as a recon vessel before it began its assault on the Trade Federation's Droid Control Ship.
name: Bravo 4
text: Deploys -1 to Naboo. May add 1 pilot. While Rya piloting, immune to attrition < 4. While at Naboo system, adds 1 to each of your Force drains there.

lore: Ellberger's starfighter at the battle of Naboo has excellent evasion capabilities, and can remain a threat to its target for as long as possible.
name: Bravo 5
text: Deploys -1 to Naboo. May add 1 pilot. While Ellberger piloting, immune to attrition < 3. While at Naboo, opponent's battleships present are power -1.

lore: Flown by an unknown pilot who likes to spin a lot. Played the deciding role in the attack against the Droid Control Ship.
name: Bravo Fighter
text: Permanent pilot provides ability of 3. During your control phase, if landed aboard Blockade Flagship, may draw one destiny. If destiny > 6, place Bravo Fighter in your Used Pile; Flagship 'blown away.'

lore: Flown by an unknown pilot who likes to spin a lot. Played the deciding role in the attack against the Droid Control Ship.
name: Bravo Fighter (V)
text: Permanent pilot provides ability of 4. May add one astromech. During battle, may target a starship with no character piloting. Draw destiny. If destiny > defense value, target hit. Immune to attrition < 3.

lore: First models designed in Roche asteroid field by Admiral Ackbar's team of Verpine engineers. Early design equipped to detect and neutralize Imperial orbital mines.
name: B-wing Attack Fighter
text: Permanent pilot provides ability of 1. May fire 2 or more weapons during battle. Each of its destiny draws is +1. During your turn, may use 1 Force to 'defuse' (lose) an Orbital Mine present.

lore: Carries weapon systems capable of taking on escort frigates and capital starships. Armed with high-powered ion cannon used to disable deflector shields.
name: B-wing Bomber
text: May add 1 pilot (suspends permanent pilot). Permanent pilot provides ability of 1. May fire two or more weapons during battle. Each of its ion cannon weapon destiny draws is +3.

lore: Blank.
name: Corran Horn In Rogue 9
text: Permanent pilot is •Corran Horn, who provides ability of 4. Weapon destiny draws are -2 here. While with a snub fighter, attrition against opponent is +1 here. Immune to attrition < 4.

lore: Lead fighter of Gold Squadron at Battle of Yavin. Flown by Jon 'Dutch' Vander. Designated Specter 1 at Renforra Base.
name: Gold 1
text: May add 2 pilots or passengers.

lore: Tiree's Y-wing during the Battle of Yavin. Custom high-power lateral thrusters provide enhanced maneuverability, allowing Gold 2 to better draw and evade enemy fire.
name: Gold 2
text: May add 2 pilots or passengers. May forfeit in place of your other starfighter hit in Death Star: Trench, restoring that starfighter to normal.

lore: Part of Pops' Y-wing squadron at the Rebel base on Dantooine. Led evacuation efforts from the base. Piloted by Ryle Torsyn.
name: Gold 3
text: If deployed to Dantooine, may retrieve 1 Force. May add 2 pilots or passengers. Proton Torpedoes deploy and fire free aboard. Immune to attrition < 4 when matching pilot aboard.

lore: Point starfighter for Gold Squadron during the approach to the Death Star. Impact scars on its hull caused by small asteroids.
name: Gold 4
text: If deployed to Anoat, may retrieve 1 Force. May add 2 pilots or passengers. SW-4 Ion Cannon deploys and fires free aboard. Immune to attrition < 4 when matching pilot aboard.

lore: Flown by the veteran Rebel fighter pilot Pops during the Battle of Yavin. He personally supervised all repairs and maintenance.
name: Gold 5
text: May add 2 pilots or passengers, and 1 astromech.

lore: Led an attack on an Imperial outpost at Kashyyyk. Disabled the outpost's shields with ion cannons. Flown by Hol Okand during the Battle of Yavin.
name: Gold 6
text: If deployed to Kashyyyk, may retrieve 1 Force. May add 2 pilots or passengers. SW-4 Ion Cannon deploys and fires free aboard. Immune to attrition < 4 when matching pilot aboard.

lore: At the Battle of Yavin, Dutch led his squadron of outdated but reliable Y-wings in the first wave of the assault against the Death Star.
name: Gold Leader In Gold 1
text: May add 1 pilot or passenger. Permanent pilot aboard is •Dutch, who provides ability of 2, adds 2 to power and may draw one battle destiny if not able to otherwise.

lore: At the Battle of Yavin, Dutch led his squadron of outdated but reliable Y-wings in the first wave of the assault against the Death Star.
name: Gold Leader In Gold 1 (V)
text: May add 1 pilot or passenger. Permanent pilot is •Dutch, who provides ability of 2. Opponent may not 'react' to here and must first use 1 Force to draw a card for battle destiny here.

lore: The Millennium Falcon relies on heavily upgraded speed and maneuverability to survive in combat. General Calrissian's starship at Battle of Endor.
name: Gold Squadron 1
text: Deploy -2 to Endor. May add 2 pilots and 2 passengers. Immune to Tallon Roll. Immune to attrition < 4 when Lando or Nien Nunb piloting (< 6 when both).

lore: Gold Squadron had the best Y-wing pilots in the Alliance. Lead by Jon 'Dutch' Vander. First wave of starfighters to assault the Death Star. Many were lost in the Battle of Yavin.
name: Gold Squadron Y-wing
text: Deploy -2 at Yavin 4 or to same location as Dutch. May add 1 pilot or passenger. Permanent pilot aboard provides ability of 2 and adds 2 to power. Adds 1 to its ion cannon weapon destiny draws.

lore: Y-wing flown by Colonel Salm at the battle of Endor. Ordered to disable capital starships between the Death star and General Calrissian.
name: Gray Squadron 1
text: May add 2 pilots or passengers. Ion cannons may fire free aboard. Each of its ion cannon destiny draws is +2. Immune to attrition < 4 when Salm or Kian piloting.

lore: Flown by Lieutenant Telsij as Colonel Salm's wingman. Part of gray squadron at the battle of Endor.
name: Gray Squadron 2
text: May add 2 pilots or passengers. Immune to attrition < 3 when Lieutenat Telsij or Karie Neth piloting (when both immune to attrition < 5 and adds one destiny to power only).

lore: Blank.
name: Green Leader In Green Squadron 1
text: Permanent pilot is •Green Leader, who provides ability of 2. Adds one battle destiny with a Rebel snub fighter. During battle, may cancel immunity to attrition of any starship here; this A-wing is 'hit.'

lore: Constructed at Chardaan Shipyards, a zero-gravity facility. Typically used as an escort for Y-wings or B-wings on critical attack missions.
name: Green Squadron 1
text: May add 1 pilot. Power -1 when opponent has a starfighter present with higher maneuver. Immune to attrition < 4 when Green Leader piloting.

lore: Flown by Tycho Celchu at the Battle of Endor. Modified canopy improves pilot vision in tight confines. Assigned to fly top cover for Millennium Falcon.
name: Green Squadron 3
text: May add 1 pilot. Power -1 when opponent has a starfighter present with higher maneuver. Maneuver +2 at a Death Star II sectors. Immune to attrition < 4 when Tycho Celchu piloting.

lore: A-wing starfighters from Green Squadron. Assigned mission of screening Rebel capital starships from enemy fighters and bombers.
name: Green Squadron A-wing
text: Deploy -1 to Sullust or same system or sector as Green Leader. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2 and adds 2 to power. Power -1 when opponent has a starfighter present with a higher maneuver.

lore: Although tempermental, this trusty hunk of junk always seems to perform for its proud owner and his Wookie co-pilot when needed the most.
name: Han, Chewie, And The Falcon
text: Permanent pilots are •Han and •Chewie: provide ability of 5, add one battle destiny, and add 5 to power. Immune to attrition < 6, Come With Me, and Lateral Damage. End of your turn: Use 3 Force to maintain OR Place out of play.

lore: Although tempermental, this trusty hunk of junk always seems to perform for its proud owner and his Wookie co-pilot when needed the most.
name: Han, Chewie, And The Falcon (V)
text: Permanent pilots are •Han and •Chewie: provide ability of 5. Attempts here to 'blow away' any Death Star are +2. Immue to Come With Me, Lateral Damage, Life Debt and attrition < 6.

lore: Heavily modified Corellian YT-1300 freighter. 'She's the fastest hunk of junk in the galaxy.'
name: Lando In Millennium Falcon
text: May add 1 pilot and 2 passengers. Permanent pilot is •Lando, who provides ability of 3 and adds 3 to power. May not be piloted by Han unless he won a hand of sabbac this game. Immune to attrition < 5.

lore: Modified YT-1300 freighter. Owned by Lando Calrissian until won by Han in a sabacc game. 26.7 meters long. 'She may not look like much, but she's got it where it counts.'
name: Millennium Falcon
text: May add 2 pilots and 2 passengers. Immune to attrition < 5 if Han, Chewie or Lando piloting. Has ship-docking capability. Must have pilot aboard to use power, maneuver or hyperspeed.

lore: Part of the Royal Naboo Air Security Forces. Designed by Theed Palace Space Vessel Engineering Corps and used in the attack on the Trade Federation Droid Control Ship.
name: Naboo Defense Fighter
text: Permanent pilot provides ability of 1. May add 1 pilot (suspends permanent pilot). Power +1 at Naboo system. While with another N-1 starfighter, draws one battle destiny if unable to otherwise.

lore: Optimized for diplomatic missions with sensor-proof pods that have ejection capabilities. Easily identified by its red coloration.
name: Obi-Wan in Radiant VII
text: May add 1 pilot. Permanent pilot is •Obi-Wan, who provides ability of 6. Opponent's starships may not 'cloak.' Your total ability here may not be reduced.

lore: Highly modified Corellian Engineering Corporation YT-2400. KonGar KGDefender military grade ion engines. Griffyn/Y2TG hyperdrive. Never boarded by Imperial customs.
name: Outrider
text: May add 2 pilots and 1 passenger. Utinni Effects which retrieve Force are immune to Alter, but are placed out of play when completed. While Dash or Leebo piloting, immune to attrition< 4.

lore: Used to combat pirate activity in and around Cloud City. Top speed in atmosphere 1,150 kph. Hyperdrive installed by Bespin Motors.
name: Overseer
text: May add Harc as a pilot. During battle, adds one destiny to total power. If a Dark Jedi or Sith was just deployed to a related site, may deploy a related location from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Immune to attrition < 4 (< 6 at Bespin).

lore: Owned by legendary Terrik family of smugglers. Used to chase down the pirates who killed Wedge's parents. On Corellian Security's most wanted list. 37.5 meters long.
name: Pulsar Skate
text: May add 2 pilots and 6 passengers. May add ability of your (•) unique smuggler aboard to X on Kessel Run targeting that smuggler. When Booster, Mirax or Wedge piloting, Immune to attrition < 5.

lore: Chromium-plated, sleek transport ship used by the royalty of the Naboo. Spaceframe was designed around a J-type configuration.
name: Queen's Royal Starship
text: May add 2 pilots and 5 passengers. Weapons may not deploy on this starship. While Ric piloting, draws one battle destiny if unable to otherwise, and immune to Lateral Damage and attrition < 4.

lore: Optimized for diplomatic missions with sensor-proof pods that have ejection capabilities. Easily identified by its red coloration.
name: Radiant VII
text: May add 3 pilots and 3 passengers. Has ship-docking capability. While Madakor or Williams piloting, immune to Lateral Damage and attrition < 5.

lore: Lead fighter of Red Squadron at Battle of Yavin. Flown by Garven Dreis. Also served at main Rebel base on Dantooine.
name: Red 1
text: May add 1 pilot.

lore: Lead fighter of Red Squadron at Battle of Yavin. Flown by Garven Dreis. Also served at main Rebel base on Dantooine.
name: Red 1 (V)
text: May add Red Leader as pilot. X-wings are immune to Tallon Roll. Once per turn, may use 1 Force to take a unique (•) Red Squadron X-wing (except Red 5) into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Immune to attrition < 5.

lore: Theron Nett's X-wing. Assigned to be Red Leader's wingman during the second attack run on the Death Star.
name: Red 10
text: Deploys free to Ord Mantell. May add 1 pilot. Proton Torpedoes deploy and fire free aboard. Immune to attrition < 4 when matching pilot aboard.

lore: Wedge's X-wing at Battle of Yavin. Wedge had to nurse the fighter home after a hit in the Death Star trench destroyed its micro-maneuvering controls.
name: Red 2
text: May add 1 pilot and 1 astromech. Immune to attrition < 3 if Wedge piloting.

lore: Biggs Darklighter's fighter at Battle of Yavin. Part of Ecliptic Evaders squadron near Sullust until transferred to Yavin Base.
name: Red 3
text: May add 1 pilot and 1 astromech.

lore: Luke's Incom T-65 X-wing at the Battle of Yavin. Instrumentation similarities between Red 5 and the T-16 skyhopper allowed Luke to play a pivotal role in the conflict.
name: Red 5
text: May add 1 pilot and 1 astromech. Immune to attrition < 4 if Luke piloting. When firing in an Attack Run, adds 1 to total.

lore: Jek Porkins' X-wing at Battle of Yavin. Instrumental in success of strafing attacks against Death Star. Skipped last inspection of computer and flight control systems.
name: Red 6
text: May add 1 pilot. Opponent may add 2 to destiny drawn for I've Got A Problem Here when targeting Red 6.

lore: Flown by Elyhek Rue. X-wing that participated in an attack on the Devastator at Ralltiir.
name: Red 7
text: Deploys free to Ralltiir. May add 1 pilot. Proton Torpedoes deploy and fire free aboard. Immune to attrition < 4 when matching pilot aboard.

lore: X-wing assigned to Bren Quersey by Wedge Antilles. Scored a hit on Black 2.
name: Red 8
text: Deploys free to Raithal. May add 1 pilot. Adds 1 to total weapon destiny when firing X-wing Laser Cannons. Immune to attrition < 4 when matching pilot aboard.

lore: X-wing assigned to Bren Quersey by Wedge Antilles. Scored a hit on Black 2.
name: Red 8 (V)
text: May deploy as a 'react'. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2. When deployed (except as a 'react'), may play a Defensive Shield from under your Starting Effect (as if from hand).

lore: Part of the relief fleet sent to Clak'dor VII. Had extra cargo room installed. Flown by Lieutenant Naytaan.
name: Red 9
text: Deploys free to Clak'dor VII. May add 1 pilot. Adds 1 to total weapon destiny when firing X-wing Laser Cannons. Immune to attrition < 4 when matching pilot aboard.

lore: Called 'Boss' or 'Chief' by his squadron, Garven Dreis was the first pilot to fire proton torpedoes at the Death Star's exhaust port during the Battle of Yavin.
name: Red Leader In Red 1
text: Permanent pilot aboard is •Red Leader, who provides ability of 2, adds 2 to power and may draw one battle destiny if not able to otherwise.

lore: Flown by Wedge Antilles as Red 2 at the Battle of Yavin. Redesignated at Endor. Rugged Incom fighter. Victory markers show it role in the attack on the first Death Star.
name: Red Squadron 1
text: May add 1 pilot. [Death Star II] Wedge deploys -2 aboard (for free if deploying to Endor). When Wedge piloting, immune to attrition < 5 and adds 6 to total when targeted by Tallon Roll.

lore: Flown by Derek 'Hobbie' Klivian during the attack on the second Death Star. Second-highest mission total of any X-wing in service for the Alliance.
name: Red Squadron 4
text: May add 1 pilot. Hobbie deploys -2 aboard. When firing X-wing Laser Cannons, may use 2 Force to make X = 3. When Hobbie piloting, maneuver +2 and immune to attrition < 4.

lore: Incom starfighter flown by Keir Santage. Flew twelve sorties against Imperial shipyards at Fondor.
name: Red Squadron 7
text: May add 1 pilot. Keir Santage deploys -2 aboard. Your other Red Squadron starfighters at same location are maneuver +1.

lore: Most Red Squadron pilots trained under Garven Dreis. Flew top cover during the Battle of Yavin. Became famous for Red 5's historic attack run.
name: Red Squadron X-wing
text: Deploy -2 at Yavin 4 or to same location as Red Leader. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2 and adds 2 to power. Proton Torpedoes deploy and fire free aboard.

lore: Manufactured by Corellian Engineering Corporation, this consular ship design serves the Republic for a variety of dignitary transportation and diplomatic missions.
name: Republic Cruiser
text: May add 1 pilot and 3 passengers. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2. Has ship-docking capability. While at same system as opponent's battleship, opponent's battle destiny draws are each -1 here.

lore: Chromium-plated, sleek transport ship used by the royalty of the Naboo. Spaceframe was designed around a J-type configuration.
name: Ric in Queen's Royal Starship
text: May add 1 pilot and 5 passengers. Permanent pilot is *Ric, who provides ability of 3. R2-D2 deploys -2 aboard. While We'll Need a New One on table, adds one battle destiny. Immune to attrition < 5.

name: Rogue One
text: May add 2 pilots and 4 passengers. May deploy with a pilot to a system without presence or Force icons. Spies deploy -1 aboard. Immune to attrition < 6 at opponent system (unless a Dark Jedi here).

lore: Blank.
name: Stolen First Order TIE Fighter
text: May add Poe (or a spy) as a pilot and one passenger. Deploys free to opponent's system. While Poe piloting, maneuver +2. If Finn aboard, apply his ability towards drawing battle destiny.

lore: Heavily modified Headhunter. Operationally assigned to support Madine's commando team. Hyperdrive added to allow it to operate independently of capital starship support.
name: Tala 1
text: May add 1 pilot. May be carried like a vehicle. Power and maneuver +2 at opponent's system (except battlegrounds) or at any sector. Immune to attrition < 4 when Colonel Cracken piloting.

lore: Equipped with sophisticated sensor suite to monitor Imperial activity during Rebel commando operations. Hyperdrive allows longrange reconnaissance.
name: Tala 2
text: May add 1 pilot. May be carried like a vehicle. When your spy aboard, opponent's spies and scouts are deploy +2 to related sites. Immune to attrition < 4 when Lieutenant Blount piloting.

name: The Falcon
text: May add 2 pilots and 2 passengers. Once per game, during your move phase, may make an additional move. While [Episode VII] Chewie, [Episode VII] Han, or Rey piloting manuver = 6 and immune to attrition < 5.

lore: Han's 'special modifications' for Millennium Falcon included security mechanisms, deflector shields, hull plating, faster hyperdrive and enhanced weapons. Enclosed.
name: The Falcon, Junkyard Garbage/The Falcon, Junkyard Garbage
text: May not be placed in Reserve Deck. If Falcon about to leave table, place it out of play. May add 2 pilots and 2 passengers. Immune to Trample and Unsalvageable. While Finn or Rey aboard, immune to attrition < 4 (< 6 if both). Once during your move phase, if piloted, may flip this card.

lore: Flown by Tycho Celchu at the Battle of Endor. Modified canopy improves pilot vision in tight confines. Assigned to fly top cover for Millennium Falcon.
name: Tycho In Green Squadron 3
text: May deploy as a 'react'. Permanent pilot is *Tycho, who provides ability of 2 and adds 3 to his [Death Star 2] Epic Event destiny draws. During battle, may target a starfighter; target's immunity to attrition is canceled.

lore: Stolen Imperial Lambda-class shuttle. Supposedly carried parts and technical crew. Delivered General Solo's crack team of Rebel scouts to the forest moon of Endor.
name: Tydirium
text: May deploy (and your characters may deploy aboard) even without presence of Force icons. May add 2 pilots and 6 passengers. While Tydirium is at a system location, your scouts deploy -1 aboard.

lore: Flown by Wedge Antilles as Red 2 at the Battle of Yavin. Redesignated at Endor. Rugged Incom fighter. Victory markers show its role in the attack on the first Death Star.
name: Wedge In Red Squadron 1
text: Permanent pilot is •Wedge, who provides ability of 3. During a battle with opponent's [Independent Starship] starship, may add one destiny to total power or attrition. Immune to Come With Me, Tallon Roll, and attrition < 4.

lore: Model T-65 by Incom Corporation. Delivered to Alliance by defecting design team. 12.5 meters long. Wings deploy in an 'X' position for better weapons coverage.
name: X-wing
text: Permanent pilot aboard provides ability of 1.

lore: Reliable and durable. Widely used freighter made by Corellian Engineering Corporation. Sales have dramatically increased in proportion to the fame of Han Solo's ship.
name: YT-1300 Transport
text: May add 1 pilot, 2 passengers and 1 vehicle. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilot provides ability of 1. Quad Laser Cannon and Surface Defense Cannon may deploy (and fire free) aboard.

lore: Rugged Rebel Alliance fighter. BTL-S3 has room for a second pilot to assist weapons operations. 16 meters long. Built by Koensayr.
name: Y-wing
text: May add 1 pilot or passenger. Permanent pilot aboard provides ability of 1.

lore: Used to combat pirate activity in and around Cloud City. Top speed in atmosphere 1,150 kph. Hyperdrive installed by Bespin Motors.
name: Z-95 Bespin Defense Fighter
text: Permanent pilot provides ability of 1 and adds 1 to power. May add one alien pilot (suspends permanent pilot). Power +2 at Bespin locations. May be carried aboard starships like a vehicle.

lore: Developed by Incom/Subpro. Atmospheric fighter adapted for space travel. AF-4 version refitted with Incom 2a fission engines and two Taim & Bak KX5 laser cannons.
name: Z-95 Headhunter
text: Permanent pilot aboard provides ability of 1. Power and Maneuver +2 at non-unique cloud sectors. May be carried aboard starships like a vehicle.

lore: Enclosed Chewie's daring capture of an Imperial AT-ST helped turn the tide in the Battle of Endor.
name: Chewie's AT-ST
text: Deploy only to Endor or same site as Chewie or opponent's AT-ST. May add 2 pilots or passengers. Subtracts 1 from power of other AT-STs at same site. Immune to attrition < 4 when Chewie piloting.

lore: Enclosed high altitude vehicle designed by Bespin Motors. Top speed of 1,500 kph. Repulsorlift drives and ion engines allow it to reach the upper atmosphere.
name: Cloud Car
text: May add 1 pilot or passenger. At cloud sectors, power +1, may deploy as a 'react' and may move and be targeted by weapons like a starfighter. Permanent pilot aboard provides ability of 1.

lore: Enclosed.
name: Dash in Rogue 10
text: May add 1 pilot. Permanent pilot is •Dash, who provides ability of 3. During battle, if with another T-47 and about to draw battle destiny, may draw two and choose one. Immune to attrition < 4.

expansion: Empire Strikes Back Introductory Two Player Game
lore: Technicians at the Rebel Base on Hoth modified T-47 airspeeders to fly in the frigid atmosphere of the ice planet. Enclosed.
name: Rebel Snowspeeder
text: May add 1 pilot or passenger. Permanent pilot aboard provides ability of 1.

lore: Designated Rogue Leader. Led snowspeeder attack during the Battle of Hoth. Enclosed. Piloted by Commander Skywalker, with Dack Ralter as tailgunner.
name: Rogue 1
text: May add 2 pilots or passengers. Immune to attrition < 3 if Luke piloting. May move as a 'react' only to Hoth sites.

lore: Enclosed. First snowspeeder to be successfully adapted to Hoth's environment. Piloted by Zev Senesca. Led team in search of Captian Solo and Commander Skywalker.
name: Rogue 2
text: May add 2 pilots or passengers. Immune to attrition < 3 if Zev piloting. May add 2 to search party destiny draw if all pilots aboard are part of that search party.

lore: Enclosed. Piloted by Commander Wedge Antilles. Successful walker tripper. Abandoned during the Rebel evacuation of Echo Base.
name: Rogue 3
text: May add 2 pilots or passengers. Immune to attrition < 3 if Wedge piloting. May move as a 'react' only to Hoth sites.

lore: Enclosed snowspeeder piloted by Derek 'Hobbie' Klivian. Wingman of Rogue Leader at the Battle of Hoth. Laser cannons modified for improved recharge rate.
name: Rogue 4
text: May add 2 pilots or passengers. May move as a 'react' only to Hoth sites. Dual Laser Cannon deploys and fires free aboard. Immune to attrition < 3 when Hobbie piloting.

lore: Enclosed Incom T-47 airspeeder adapted for use in hot, dry conditions. Maximum speed 600 kilometers per hour. Drive section left exposed for easier maintenance.
name: Sandspeeder
text: May add 1 pilot or passenger. Permanent pilot provides ability of 1. May move as a 'react' to Tatooine or desert sites.

lore: Modified Incom T-47 airspeeder. Enclosed. Adapted to the cold by installation of regulator coil heaters. Rebels typically nickname converted speeders after the intended environment.
name: Snowspeeder
text: May add 1 pilot or passenger. Permanent pilot aboard provides ability of 1. May move as a 'react' to Hoth sites.

lore: Aratech speeder bikes often found their way into Rebel hands. Stolen from troops operating far from Imperial maintenance facilities.
name: Speeder Bike
text: May add 1 pilot and 1 passenger. May move as a 'react'. When piloted, vehicle and scouts aboard are immune to attrition < 4. Pilot's power = 0. If lost, characters aboard may 'jump off' (disembark).

lore: Herd animal native to Tatooine. Adults are used as beasts of burden, while the young and elderly eopies are useful for consuming desert weeds.
name: Eopie
text: May add 2 'riders' (passengers). Ability = 1/4.Moves for free. While 'ridden' by Amidala in battle, adds one battle destiny.

lore: Pack animal domesticated by Gungan warriors. Able to bear heavy loads, even during the heat of combat.
name: Fambaa
text: May add 2 'riders' (passengers). Ability + 1/2. Requires +1 Force to use landspeed. May not be attacked by creatures.

lore: Used by many Gungan warriors due to their fearless nature. Kaadu lay large numbers of eggs to compensate for those eaten by predators.
name: Kaadu
text: May add 1 'rider' (passenger). Ability = 1/2. Moves for free. While 'ridden' by a Gungan, may move as a 'react.' While at a swamp, adds 1 to your Force drains there.

lore: Fled into the wilderness after mistreatment by a young Tusken Raider. Raised by moisture farmer. Friendly toward strangers, but attacks Tusken Raiders on sight.
name: Rogue Bantha
text: May add 2 'riders' (passengers). Bantha ability = 1/2. May move as a 'react.' Whenever a battle was just initiated at same site, one Tusken Raider present (your choice) is 'trampled' (immediately lost).

lore: Creatures used as beasts of burden by Jawas. Tremendous strength makes them excellent pack animals. Very skittish around repulsorlift vehicles.
name: Ronto
text: May add 2 'riders' (passengers). Ability=1/4. When 'ridden' by a Jawa, moves for free and draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise.

lore: First native creature found on Hoth. Roam the icy plans in herds. Illtempered and easily spooked. Smell bad on the outside. Trained as steeds for Rebel patrols.
name: Tauntaun
text: May add 1 'rider' (passenger). Deploy only on Hoth. Ability = 1/4. May move as a 'react' from a battle. May be 'sacrificed' (lost) to make rider immune to Exposure this turn.

lore: Enclosed vehicle used for shuttling and hot-rodding. E-16/x ion engine pushes T-16 up to 1200 kph.
name: Incom T-16 Skyhopper
text: May add 1 passenger. Permanent pilot provides ability of 1. May move as a 'react.' * Landspeed = 4. OR 1 character may shuttle to or from same site for free.

lore: Enclosed vehicle used by Luke Skywalker for his early pilot training. Often raced with Biggs Darklighter through Beggar's Canyon.
name: Luke's T-16 Skyhopper
text: Requires 1 pilot to use. May carry 1 passenger. May move as a 'react.' may 'bullseye' one Womp Rat per turn. *Landspeed = 4, OR 1 character may shuttle to or from same site for free.

lore: Features maneuvering flaps and repulsorlift engines. High speed and sensitive controls make swoops hard to drive. Outracing slavers on Bonadan, Han escaped on an Air-2.
name: Air-2 Racing Swoop
text: May add 1 driver and 1 passenger. *Landspeed = Driver's ability, and once per turn, may follow an opponent's vehicle or character that just moved from same site (if within range).

lore: Primitive flying vehicle used by Ewoks. Used to drop rocks on Imperial troops during the Battle of Endor.
name: Ewok Glider
text: May add 1 driver (must be an Ewok). Once per turn, when in battle, may target a character or creature present. Draw destiny. Target hit if destiny -1 > defense value.

lore: Military repulsorlift armed with three light repeating blasters. With a top speed of 160 kilometers per hour, they have the ability to out-flank an opponent in battle.
name: Gian Speeder
text: May add 1 driver and 3 passengers. May move as a 'react' to Naboo sites. Your battle destiny draws are +1 for each of your Royal Naboo Security present. (Limit +3.)

lore: Provides enclosed shelter from harsh Tatooine climate, Tusken Raiders and krayt dragons. Kalit offers sanctuary to others when traveling (even members of enemy Jawa tribes).
name: Kalit's Sandcrawler
text: Deploys only on Tatooine. May add 1 driver and 7 passengers. While your Jawa is aboard, this vehicle and your Jawas at same site are immune to attrition < 3 (< 5 if Kalit at same site).

lore: System of enclosed high-speed vertical and horizontal transport cylinders. Used in space stations, large starships, Death Stars, etc.
name: Lift Tube
text: May carry 4 passengers. Deploy and move only at interior mobile sites. May move without presence aboard. Also, may move as a 'react' only to a battle or Force drain (if within range).

lore: Skywalker's SoroSuub. Common open (AI)r transport. Top speed 250 km per hour. Repulsorlift drive keeps it suspended one meter above ground, even when parked.
name: Luke's X-34 Landspeeder
text: May add 1 driver and 2 passengers. Moves free if Luke aboard. May move as a 'react.'

lore: Small, lightly armed, enclosed vehicle widely used throughout the galaxy. Sometimes used as a pleasure craft by wealthy eccentrics.
name: Patrol Craft
text: Power +1 or Coruscant of Bespin. May add 1 driver and 1 passenger. May deploy or move as a 'react.' At cloud sectors, may move and be targeted by weapons like a starfighter.

lore: Repulsor lift skiffs are used by traders and merchants to safely cross the deserts of Tatooine. Young thrill seekers sometimes upgrade them with high-powered engines.
name: Racing Skiff
text: May deploy with a non-unique alien driver as a 'react'. May add 1 driver and 3 passengers. May move as a 'react'. If lost, any characters aboard may 'jump off' (disembark).

lore: Warren-like enclosed homes for Jawa tribes. Protects against Tatooine predators. Originally mining vehicles. Jawas claimed them when mines abandoned. No two look alike.
name: Sandcrawler
text: Deploys only to a Tatooine site. May add 1 driver and 7 passengers. May relocate only to planet sites. Adds 1 to forfeit of each Jawa at same exterior site.

lore: Top speed of 250 kph. Repulsorlift engine. Equipped with two electromagnetic load lifters. Frequently used by shipping companies to transfer cargo between freighters.
name: Skiff
text: Deploy -1 to a Tatooine site. May add 1 driver and 5 passengers. May move as a 'react.' If lost, any characters aboard may 'jump off' (disembark).

lore: Typical old model Courier landspeeder such as the one used by Lars family for trips to Anchorhead. Has cargo compartment. Enclosed seating.
name: SoroSuub V-35 Landspeeder
text: May add 1 driver and 3 passengers. Moves free if Owen Lars, Beru Lars or Luke aboard. May move as a 'react'.

lore: Atgar 1.4 FD P-tower anti-vehicle cannon. Adapted to operate with minimal performance loss in the extremes of a cold environment.
name: Atgar Laser Cannon
text: Deploy on an exterior planet site. Your warrior present may target a vehicle at same or adjacent site using 2 Force. Draw destiny. Target crashes if destiny +2 > armor. Target hit if destiny +1 > maneuver.

lore: Crowning achievement of Chirpa's engineers. Heavy stones from these weapons distracted Imperial AT-ST walkers.
name: Ewok Catapult
text: Deploy on an exterior Endor site. Does not require a power source. Your Ewok present may target a vehicle with armor at same or adjacent site for free. Draw destiny. Add 1 for each Ewok present. Target crashes if total destiny > defense value.

lore: Modified Golan Arms DForfeit: 9 anti-infantry battery. Proton-shielded control cylinder capped by one or more rotating turret-mounted laser cannons.
name: Golan Laser Battery
text: Deploy on any exterior planet site. Your warrior present may target a creature, character or vehicle at same or adjacent site using 2 Force. Draw destiny. Add 2 if targeting a creature or character. Target hit if destiny > defense value.

lore: Merr-Sonn Mark II repeating blaster. Accepts power cells from a very wide variety of sources, a benefit for Rebels accustomed to scavenging for supplies.
name: Medium Repeating Blaster Cannon
text: Deploy on a site. May be moved by two warriors for 1 additional Force. Your warrior present may target up to two characters or two creatures at same or adjacent site using 2 Force. Draw two destiny. Target(s) hit if total destiny > total defense value.

lore: KDY v-150 surface-to-space heavy ion cannon. The most powerful ground-based weapon in the Rebel arsenal. Reserved for strategic installations due to limited supply.
name: Planet Defender Ion Cannon
text: Deploy on an exterior Rebel Base site. During a battle at related system, may target a capital starship there using 2 Force. Draw destiny. If destiny +3 > armor, all starship weapons aboard target are lost, power = 0 and hyperspeed = 0.

lore: Standard explosive charge carried by Rebel commandos. When used in multiple, these charges have the explosive capacity to level a heavily armored structure.
name: Explosive Charge
text: Deploy on an interior site you occupy. Immune to Overload. Place in Used Pile if opponent controls this site. If you just lost a battle opponent initiated here, may draw destiny. All cards (except Effects) here are lost if destiny > 4 (otherwise, Charge lost).

lore: Deadly explosive typically planted on the perimeter of strategic sites or high-security installations to prevent Rebel spies and saboteurs from gaining access.
name: Infantry Mine
text: Deploy at same exterior site as your mining droid. 'Explodes' if a character deploys or moves (without using a vehicle or starfighter) to or across same site. Draw destiny. Character lost if destiny +2 > ability. Infantry Mine is also lost.

lore: Military version of a 'remote.' Programmed to stalk specific targets or secondary targets. Heat and light sensors track with fatal accuracy. Can stow away on starships.
name: Motti Seeker
text: Deploys for 1 Force to an unoccupied site. Deploys and moves like an undercover spy. When present with Motti (or pilot) of ability < 3, choose one to be immediately lost (treat as an 'all cards' situation). Seeker also lost.

lore: Often Stolen from the Empire. Used by the Rebellion to protect key spaceports. Can be released to cover the retreat of a fleeing strike force.
name: Orbital Mine
text: Deploy at the same system as a bomber. 'Explodes' if an opponents starship deploys or moves here. Draw destiny. Add 2 when targeting a capital starship. Starship lost if total destiny > defense value. Orbital mine is also lost.

lore: Military version of a 'remote.' Programmed to stalk specific targets or secondary targets. Heat and light sensors track with fatal accuracy. Can stow away on starships.
name: Tagge Seeker
text: Deploys for 1 Force to an unoccupied site. Deploys and moves like an undercover spy. When present with Tagge (or warrior) of ability < 3, choose one to be immediately lost (treat as an 'all cards' situation). Seeker is also lost.

lore: Military version of a 'remote.' Programmed to stalk specific targets or secondary targets. Heat and light sensors track with fatal accuracy. Can stow away on starships.
name: Tarkin Seeker
text: Deploys for 1 Force to an unoccupied site. Deploys and moves like an undercover spy. When present with Tarkin (or alien) of ability < 3, choose one to be immediately lost (treat as an 'all cards' situation). Seeker is also lost.

lore: A timer-activated explosive device designed to be placed by a mining droid. Typically used in ore and spice mines for demolition. Also has many military applications.
name: Timer Mine
text: Deploy on opponent's side at same site as one of your mining droids. 'Explodes' at beginning of your next turn. Draw destiny. That number of opponent's characters there are immediately lost (owner's choice). Timer Mine is also lost.

lore: Mine controlled by microcircuitry calibrated to ignore infantry and creatures. Explodes only when triggered by metallic vehicles.
name: Vehicle Mine
text: Deploy at same exterior site as your mining droid. 'Explodes' if starfighter (use 5 as defense value) or non-creature vehicle deploys or moves to or across same site.  Draw destiny.  Target lost if destiny +2 > defense value.  Vehicle Mine also lost.

lore: BlasTech sharpshooter rifle accurate to 500 meters. Corporal Janse brought several A280s with him when he left BlasTech.
name: A280 Sharpshooter Rifle
text: Use 2 Force to deploy on your scout warrior. May target a character, creature or vehicle at same or adjacent site for free. Draw destiny. Add 2 if warrior is alone and target is at an adjacent site. Target hit if total destiny > defense value.

lore: Amidala's ability as a warrior is underestimated by those who encounter her. With her weapon of choice, she often uses this fact to her advantage.
name: Amidala's Blaster
text: Deploy on Amidala. May target a character or creature for free. Draw destiny. Character is power and forfeit = 0 if destiny > defense value. Creature lost if destiny +2 > defense value.

lore: Constructed by Anakin Skywalker. Kept by Obi-Wan Kenobi until given to Luke.
name: Anakin's Lightsaber
text: Deploy on your Skywalker of ability > 3. May add 1 to Force drain where present. May target a character or creature for free. Draw two destiny. Target hit, and its forfeit = 0, if total destiny > defense value.

lore: Constructed by Anakin Skywalker. Kept by Obi-Wan Kenobi until given to Luke.
name: Anakin's Lightsaber (V)
text: Deploy on Leia, non-Jedi Luke, or any Mara. May add 1 to Force drain where present. May target a character or creature. Draw two destiny. Target hit, and its forfeit = 0, if total destiny > defense value. Instead of firing, may use 1 Force to cancel a just drawn weapon destiny here.

lore: Modified by Alliance armorers who defected from the BlasTech corporation. Expensive cooling system incorporated to allow higher fire rate.
name: BlasTech E-11B Blaster Rifle
text: Use 2 Force to deploy on your scout warrior. May target a character, creature or vehicle using 1 Force. Draw destiny. Target hit if destiny > defense value. May fire repeatedly for 2 Force each time.

lore: A Merr-Sonn Model 44 blaster pistol. Uses power packs and highenergy blaster gases to shoot bolts of explosive coherent light energy.
name: Blaster
text: Use 1 Force to deploy on your warrior. May target a character, creature or vehicle using 1 Force. Draw destiny. Target hit if destiny > defense value.

lore: BlasTech E-11 blaster rifle. Standard issue for Imperial forces. So numerous that many have been stolen by Rebels. Extendable stock. Carries energy for 100 shots.
name: Blaster Rifle
text: Use 2 Force to deploy on your warrior. May target a character, creature or vehicle using 2 Force. Draw destiny. Target hit if destiny +1 > defense value.

lore: BlasTech E-11 blaster rifle. Standard issue for Imperial forces. So numerous that many have been stolen by Rebels. Extendable stock. Carries energy for 100 shots.
name: Blaster Rifle (V)
text: Deploy on your Republic warrior; warrior is power +1. May target a character, creature, or vehicle for free. Draw destiny; add 1 if targeting a character, 2 if a vehicle. Target hit, and may not be used to satisfy attrition, if total destiny > defense value.

lore: Hand-crafted weapon of choice among Wookiees. Fires explosive 'quarrels' (which look like blaster bolts). Requires great strength to use. Extra ammo carried on bandoleers.
name: Bowcaster
text: Use X Force to deploy on your warrior, where X = (7 - warrior's power). X cannot fall below 1. May target a character or creature using X Force. Draw destiny. Add 1 if targeting a character, 2 if targeting a creature. Target hit if total destiny > defense value.

lore: Tarpals' electropole is nearly as old as he is. Used to enforce the laws of Otoh Gunga.
name: Captain Tarpals' Electropole
text: Deploys on Captain Tarpals. May 'throw' (place in Used Pile) to target a character, creature or vehicle for free. Draw destiny. If destiny +3 > defense value, target is landspeed = 0 and power - 3 for remainder of turn.

lore: Specially modified by Chewbacca. Fires larger bolts with more accuracy. Superior targeting at long distances.
name: Chewbacca's Bowcaster
text: Deploy on Chewie, or use 4 Force to deploy on your other Wookiee. May target a character, creature or vehicle using 3 Force (for free if Chewie firing). Draw two destiny. Target hit if total destiny > defense value. If hit by Chewie, target's forfeit = 0.

lore: Black market ties make it possible for the Cloud City quartermaster to acquire powerful weapons such as this. Low refraction index provides minimal beam dispersion.
name: Cloud City Blaster
text: Use 2 Force to deploy on your warrior at a Cloud City site. May target a character or creature using 2 Force. Draw destiny. Target hit (and may not be used to satisfy attrition) if destiny > defense value.

lore: Mier-Lan V-59 grenade. Blows stuff up.
name: Concussion Grenade
text: Use 2 Force to deploy on your warrior. May 'throw' at same or adjacent site. Draw destiny. All characters, weapons and devices with that destiny number present at that site are lost. (Only your warrior is lost if destiny = 0.) Concussion Grenade also lost.

lore: llegal weapon easily purchased by Rebel suppliers on the black market. Rechargeable energy packs make it a cost-effective weapon.
name: Disruptor Pistol
text: Use 2 Force to deploy on your warrior (1 on your non-unique warrior). May target a character or creature using 2 Force (for free if on your non-unique warrior). Draw Destiny. Target lost if destiny > defense value.

lore: BlasTech A295 blaster rifle. Standard-issue longarm at Echo Base. Highly accurate with good range. Favored by marksmen and snipers in a hostile environment.
name: Echo Base Trooper Rifle
text: Use 3 Force to deploy on your warrior (Free on your Echo Base trooper). May target a character, creature or vehicle at same or adjacent site using 2 Force (1 if fired by an Echo Base trooper). Draw Destiny. Target hit if destiny +1 > defense value.

lore: Gungan weapon that is very similar to the Force pike. Used to control crowds, wild animals, and the occasional battle droid.
name: Electropole
text: Deploy on your Gungan. May target a character for free. Draw destiny. If destiny > defense value, character is power -4 for remainder of turn. At the end of battle here, may place this electropole on top of Reserve Deck.

lore: Primitive weapon. Effective in large volleys. Imperial troops are not prepared for such simple tactics.
name: Ewok Bow
text: Use 1 Force to deploy on your Ewok. May target a character or creature using 1 Force. Draw destiny. Add 1 for each other Ewok present who is armed with an Ewok Bow. Target hit if total destiny > defense value.

lore: Chosen weapon of most Ewok warriors. Pointed tip made of stone or animal horn.
name: Ewok Spear
text: Use 2 Force to deploy on your Ewok (free on Ewok Spearman). Adds 1 to power. May target a character or creature using 1 Force. Both players draw destiny. Target's power or ferocity for remainder of turn = 0 if your destiny + Ewok's power > opponent's destiny.

lore: BlasTech DL-44 heavy pistol. Short range, but relatively powerful. Carries energy for 25 shots. Illegal or restricted on most systems.
name: Han's Heavy Blaster Pistol
text: Use 1 Force to deploy on Han, or 3 on your warrior. May target a character, creature or vehicle using 1 Force. Draw destiny. Target hit if destiny +1 > defense value. If hit by Han, target's forfeit = 0.

lore: BlasTech DL-44 heavy pistol. Short range, but relatively powerful. Carries energy for 25 shots. Illegal or restricted on most systems.
name: Han's Heavy Blaster Pistol (V)
text: Deploy on Han (except TK-422), even as a 'react.' May target a character or creature for free. Draw destiny. Target hit, its forfeit = 0, and opponent loses 1 Force if destiny +1 > defense value. Once during your control phase, may fire using 1 Force.

lore: Jar Jar had to be instructed on how to use an electropole prior to the battle on the great grass plains. It's not his weapon of choice.
name: Jar Jar's Electropole
text: Deploys on Jar Jar. May 'throw' (place in Used Pile) to target a character, creature or vehicle. Draw destiny. If destiny +2 > defense value, target is landspeed = 0 and power -2 for remainder of turn.

lore: Cobbled-together weapon built from salvaged power cells, droid restraining bolts and an ion accelerator. Fires a stream of ion energy that stuns droids and irritates others.
name: Jawa Ion Gun
text: Use 1 Force to deploy on your Jawa, 3 on your warrior. May target a character using 1 Force. Draw destiny. Targeted droid stolen if destiny +1 > forfeit. Targeted non-droid character excluded from battle if destiny = defense value.

lore: Elegant sword of pure energy. 'This is the weapon of a Jedi Knight. Not as clumsy or as random as a blaster. A lightsaber can be dangerous to an unskilled user.'
name: Jedi Lightsaber
text: Use X Force to deploy on your warrior where X = (7 - warrior's ability). May add 1 to Force drain where present. May target a character or creature by using X Force. Draw two destiny. Target hit if total destiny > defense value.

lore: Standard-issue Imperial blaster rifle appropriated by Lando from a stormtrooper. Used by Calrissian to pin down stormtroopers as he made his escape from Cloud City.
name: Lando's Blaster Rifle
text: Deploy on your Lando or use 3 Force to deploy on your other warrior. May target a character, creature or vehicle using 1 Force. If Lando targeting a character, target is power -2 for remainder of turn. Draw destiny. Target hit if destiny +1 > defense value.

lore: Standard production blaster rifle issued at Echo Base. Modified by Rebel engineers for Leia's use. Has less recoil and a higher recharge rate.
name: Leia's Blaster Rifle
text: Deploy on your Leia or use 3 Force to deploy on your other warrior. May target a character, creature or vehicle using 1 Force. Draw destiny. Target hit if destiny +1 > defense value. If hit by Leia, target is lost.

lore: Defender sporting blaster, made by Drearian Defense Conglomerate. Intended for personal defense or small-game hunting. Short range. Low power. Carries energy for 50 shots.
name: Leia's Sporting Blaster
text: Use 1 Force to deploy on Leia, or 2 on your warrior. May target a character, creature or vehicle for free. Draw destiny. Target hit if destiny -1 > defense value. If hit by Leia, target's forfeit = 0.

lore: Merr-Sonn Model 57. Part of an arms lot purchased for the Alliance from a black market dealer on Ord Mantell. Carried by Luke as a backup for his father's lightsaber.
name: Luke's Blaster Pistol
text: Use 1 Force to deploy on Luke, 3 on your other warrior. May target a character, creature or vehicle using 2 Force (if targeted by Luke, target loses immunity to attrition for remainder of turn.) Draw destiny. Add 1 if targeting a character or creature. Target hit if total destiny > defense value.

lore: Czerka 6-2Aug2. Extended barrel provides long-range targeting without expensive laser sight. Sturdy construction, but no match for a Tusken Raider's gaderffi stick.
name: Luke's Hunting Rifle
text: Use 1 Force to deploy on Luke or Owen Lars, 3 on your non-droid character. May target a character or creature using 1 Force. Draw destiny. Subtract 1 if targeting a character. Add 2 if targeting a creature. Target hit if total destiny > defense value.

lore: Weapon of a truly powerful warrior. Constructed by Luke as part of his training.
name: Luke's Lightsaber
text: Deploy on Luke. Adds 1 to defense value and training destiny. May add 1 to Force drain where present. May target a character, creature, speeder bike, or swoop for free. Draw 2 destiny. Target hit, and its forfeit = 0 if total destiny > defense value.

lore: Elegant sword of pure energy. 'This is the weapon of a Jedi Knight. Not as clumsy or as random as a blaster.' A lightsaber can be dangerous to an unskilled user.
name: Mace Windu's Lightsaber
text: Deploy on Mace. May add 1 to Force drain where present. Mace may add 1 to his duel total. May target a character or creature for free. Draw two destiny. Target hit, and its forfeit = 0, if total destiny > defense value.

lore: Easily obtained by the Rebellion. Many are copies of the BlasTech DL-18 design. Plentiful on Tatooine. Used for suppressive fire.
name: Mos Eisley Blaster
text: Use 1 Force to deploy on your alien warrior (free if on Tatooine). May target a character for free. Draw destiny. Target is forfeit -2 for remainder of turn if destiny +2 > defense value.

lore: Standard issue blaster given to Naboo security volunteers. Noted for its effectiveness in battle and cheap manufacturing cost.
name: Naboo Blaster Rifle
text: Use 1 Force to deploy on your warrior. May target a character, creature, vehicle using 1 Force. Draw destiny. Target hit if destiny +2 > defense value.

lore: Used primarily by high-ranking Naboo security officers, and known for its precision targeting.
name: Naboo Security Officer Blaster
text: Use 1 Force to deploy on your warrior. May target a character, creature, vehicle for free. Draw destiny. Add 1 if fired by a leader. Target hit if total destiny > defense value.

lore: 'An elegant weapon for a more civilized time.' Miniaturized power cell. Uses rare crystals to focus the lightblade. This lightsaber was personally built by Obi-Wan.
name: Obi-Wan's Lightsaber
text: Deploy on Obi-Wan. May add 1 to Force drain where present. May target a character or creature for free. Draw two destiny. Target hit, and its forfeit = 0, if total destiny > defense value.

lore: Constructed by Obi-Wan himself, this Padawan's lightsaber was responsible for tearing an ancient Sith weapon in half.
name: Obi-Wan's Lightsaber
text: Deploy on [Episode I] Obi-Wan. May add 1 to Force drain if present at a Naboo battleground. May target a character or creature for free. Draw two destiny. Add 1 if targeting a Dark Jedi. Target hit, and its forfeit = 0, if total destiny > defense value.

lore: Naboo blaster personally modified by Captain Panaka. Boosted by extra power packs that allow it to maintain sustained fire in tense situations.
name: Panaka's Blaster
text: Deploy on Panaka. May target a character, creature, or vehicle for free. Draw destiny. Target hit if destiny +2 > defense value. When this blaster hits a character or vehicle in battle, your total power here is +3 for remainder of battle.

lore: Qui-Gon was forced to defend himself when Darth Maul tracked them down on Tatooine. He was barely able to escape, in order to fight another day.
name: Qui-Gon Jinn's Lightsaber
text: Deploy on Qui-Gon. May add 1 to Force drain where present. May target a character or creature. Draw two destiny. Target hit, and its forfeit = 0, if total destiny > defense value.

lore: Qui-Gon was forced to defend himself when Darth Maul tracked them down on Tatooine. He was barely able to escape, in order to fight another day.
name: Qui-Gon Jinn's Lightsaber (AI)
text: Deploy on Qui-Gon. May add 1 to Force drain where present. May target a character or creature. Draw two destiny. Target hit, and its forfeit = 0, if total destiny > defense value.

lore: This lightsaber bore silent witness to the death of two great warriors in the same day. One a Jedi, one a Sith.
name: Qui-Gon's Lightsaber
text: Deploy on Qui-Gon or [Episode I] Obi-Wan. Adds 1 to this character's lightsaber combat total. May target a character for free. Draw two destiny. Target hit, and it forfeit = 0, if total destiny > defense value (if hit target is a Dark Jedi, opponent also loses 1 Force).

lore: Stolen Merr-Sonn blaster. Causes no permanent damage, though efficiently immobilizes its target. Effects are more severe on animals without a thick hide.
name: Stun Blaster
text: Deploy on your warrior. May target a character or creature (except rancor or Sarlacc) using 2 Force. Draw destiny. Return character (and cards deployed on character) to owner's hand if destiny +1 > defense value. Creature lost if destiny +3 > defense value.

lore: Vibrating blade powered by an energy cell hidden within the shaft. Used by many moisture farmers to prod banthas and other animals.
name: Vibro-Ax
text: Use 3 Force to deploy on any alien warrior. Adds 1 to power. May target a character using 1 Force. Both players draw destiny. Target immediately excluded from battle if warrior's power + your destiny > target's power + opponent's destiny.

lore: Equipped with targeting sensor system. Weapon mounts pivot up to 60 degrees to improve targeting.
name: A-wing Cannon
text: Deploy on your A-Wing. May target a starfighter or squadron for free. Draw destiny. Add your starship's maneuver. Target hit if total destiny > twice target's defense value.

lore: Used by veteran smugglers. Defend transports from maneuverable TIE fighters. Frequently used to arm Rebellion transports and freighters.
name: Concussion Missiles
text: Use 1 Force to deploy on your bomber, A-wing, freighter, or transport. May target a starship for free. Draw destiny. Add 1 if targetting a starfighter or squadron. Target hit if total destiny > defense value.

lore: Often modified by Rebel technicians. Heavy warhead provides increased armor penetration. Decreased maneuverability and effectiveness against starfighters.
name: Enhanced Proton Torpedoes
text: Deploy on your X-wing, Y-wing or B-wing. May target a starship for 1 Force. Add 1 if targetting a capital starship. Otherwise, subtract 1. Target hit if total destiny > defense value.

lore: Built to penetrate the armor of the toughest Star Destroyers. Cooling technology pilfered from the Empire.
name: Heavy Turbolaser Battery
text: Use 4 Force to deploy on your Star Cruiser. Adds 2 to power. May target a starship using 2 Force. Draw two destiny. Subtract 1 when targeting a capital starship. Otherwise, subtract 6. Target hit if total destiny > defense value.

lore: Prototype missile developed by Slayn & Korpil. Ionizing warhead disrupts onboard systems. Capable of destroying capital starships by overloading shield generators.
name: Intruder Missile
text: Deploy on your B-wing, Z-95, YT-1300 Transport, or Falcon. May target a capital starship for free. Draw destiny. Add 3 if that capital starship was targeted by another weapon this turn. Target hit if total destiny > defense value. After firing, place Missile in Used Pile.

lore: Mainstay weapon of Naboo Defense Fighters. Anakin Skywalker used them to surprising effect, as soon as he found the trigger.
name: Proton Torpedoes
text: Use 1 Force to deploy on your N-1 starfighter. May target a starship using 1 Force. Draw Destiny. Target hit if destiny > defense value. While on Bravo Fighter and you are attempting to 'blow away' Blockade Flagship, adds 2 to your total.

lore: Powerful ballistic projectiles. Carries proton-scattering energy warheads. Short range. Pierces energy shields, but blocked by particle shields.
name: Proton Torpedoes
text: Use 1 Force to deploy on your X-wing, Y-wing or B-wing. May target a starship using 1 Force. Draw destiny. Target hit if destiny > defense value.

lore: Starship blaster, often slung in turret mounts to take advantage of light weight and quick targeting motions. Installed on many starships including the Millennium Falcon.
name: Quad Laser Cannon
text: Use 2 Force to deploy on your Corellian Corvette or Falcon. May target a starship using 1 Force. Draw destiny. Add 1 if targeting a starfighter. Target hit if total destiny > defense value.

lore: BlasTech Ax-108 'Ground Buzzer' blaster cannon. Designed to drop from a concealed gun pod on a starship. Targets using proximity motion sensors. Has 360-degree firing arc.
name: Surface Defense Cannon
text: Use 1 Force to deploy on your starfighter, free on Falcon. May target a character or creature at same site using 1 Force. Draw destiny. Target hit if destiny +1 > defense value.

lore: ArMek SW-4 turret-mounted ion cannon. Bursts of ionized energy fuse and overload target's mechanical and computer systems. Allows ships to be captured and boarded.
name: SW-4 Ion Cannon
text: Use 1 Force to deploy on your Y-wing or B-wing. May target a starship using 1 Force. Draw destiny. If destiny > target's defense value, all starship weapons deployed on target are lost, armor or maneuver = 0 and hyperspeed = 0.

lore: Quad Taim & Bak KX9 laser cannon. Fires singly or linked in groups of two or four. Smart pilots conserve energy and select only the cannons needed to score a hit.
name: X-wing Laser Cannon
text: Deploy on your X-wing. May target a starfighter using X Force, where X=0 to 3. Draw destiny. If destiny + X > defense value, target hit (lost instead if X=3).

lore: Launched from fambaa-mounted catapults. Gungan 'energy balls' are used to disable a variety of mechanized threats. Effectiveness is enhanced by the skill of the user.
name: Booma
text: Deploy on your Fambaa. Twice during battle may draw destiny. If destiny < total number of opponent's characters and vehicles present, one of them is lost (opponent's choice).

lore: Sund x2-100 laser cannon. Popular among outlaw organizations because it is both cheap and powerful. Frequently mounted on T-47 airspeeders.
name: Dual Laser Cannon
text: Use 2 Force to deploy on your T-47. May target a character, creature or vehicle using 1 Force. Draw destiny. Subtract 1 if targeting a character or creature. Add 2 if targeting a vehicle. Target hit if total destiny > defense value.

lore: High-powered harpoon attached to a retractable flexi-steel tow cable and fusion-head disk designed by Beryl Chiffonage as a reserve defense against Imperial AT-ATs.
name: Power Harpoon
text: Use 2 Force to deploy on your combat or shuttle vehicle. May target an AT-AT or AT-ST for 1 Force. Draw destiny. Target crashes if destiny + your vehicle's maneuver > 8. Your vehicle crashes if destiny = 0.
